subject: Re: Getting @Ignore reported?
msgSnippet: This is a known issue in Ant: https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=43969 U
messageBody:
This is a known issue in Ant:

https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=43969

U


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Pigneri, Rocco" <rpigneri@...> wrote:
>
> Bob,
>
>
>
> Given that the tests correctly appear in the JUnit test suite, it seems
> to me that the problem is in the Ant runner and not in JUnit itself.
> Since I am not very familiar with Ant and have recently switched back to
> JUnit after a few years on NUnit, I am not certain if this is something
> that we here can help you with. An ant list might be more helpful.
>
>
>
> Other than that, the only thing that I can think of is to go back to the
> basics and see what you can find out: which version of JUnit is Ant
> running? What command line call is it using? Is there an option not to
> report Ignore'd tests? Is there a bug in that version of JUnit such
> that Ignore'd tests are not reported? Will upgrading JUnit or Ant solve
> the problem? I'm sure you get the idea J.
>
>
> Hope that helps,
>
>
>
> Rocco
>
>
>
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
> resendes
> Sent: Friday, February 13, 2009 7:50 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: Getting @Ignore reported?
>
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> ,
> "Pigneri, Rocco" <rpigneri@> wrote:
> >
> > Dear Bob,
> >
> >
> >
> > You need to use both the @Test and the @Ignore annotations in order to
> > get the behavior that you want. Without the @Test annotation, the test
> > runner does not consider the function a test and ignores it.
> >
> Rocco,
> Thanks for the hint. I tried it, but it didn't seem to change the ant
> output:
>
> $ ant unittest
> [snip]
> unittest:
> [junit] Running TTest
> [junit] Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 0.103 sec
>
> [Note: no indication of ignored tests, above, or in the generated HTML
> report.]
>
> $ java -ea -cp /usr/share/java/junit4.jar:classes:test-classes
> org.junit.runner.JUnitCore TTest
> JUnit version 4.3.1
> .I.
> Time: 0.022
>
> OK (2 tests)
>
> At least the "native" runner indicates "I", which I'm assuming means
> "ignored". Is there any runner/formatter combination that makes this
> information more explicit?
> Regards,
> Bob
>
>
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
